This is random, but I was in want of a veggie restaurant in Barcelona and thankfully found this on Yelp (thanks guys!!).Overall, just SO thankful to finally get some veggies in my diet and some cleansing juices after a week of drinking, tapas, and jamons.  They were also open on Sunday.  Praise God.  Plus, they speak English here, the restaurant is super cute, and there's a pretty good variety.  I can't recall what I got, but they usually have daily specials which look good, and there are plenty of food that appears non-vegetarian but are vegetarian.  I don't know if that makes sense... Like veggie burgers, and etc.The minus 1-star is the fact that some of my leaves were wilted.  It didn't feel like the 'freshest' food I've had, as in typical vegan places in Cali.  I was kind of disappointed by that, but I've also experienced that with many places in Barcelona.  I kind of attribute it to the fact that food isn't as easily wasted in restaurants in some places in Spain vs. the US.  I don't know if that's a false assumption.  But regardless, still a great find.
